p: This method consists of four steps: sample immersion into the alginate dispersions followed by withdrawing the sample and draining the excessive film-forming solution covering the product. Then, a second immersion of the alginate coated sample into the crosslinking bath to achieve the gel formation and draining of the excessive solution [ 170]. The dipping process is generally very short, therefore the evaporation from solvents in the coating and crosslinking solutions are neglected [ 171]. The duration of the dipping and draining times differ from each study, but it is generally between 30 s to 5 min. The main advantage of the method is its total coating even around complex and rough surfaces [ 172].
